13.Ahmed Hulusi: “When we heard the guidance (Quran), we believed it was the reality. And whoever believes in his Rabb as his own reality, will not fear any deprivation (of his rights) or derogation.”

14.Ahmed Hulusi: “And among us are those in submission, and among us are wrongdoers who rebel against the commands. And those who submit are the aspirants of the fullness of the reality.”

15.Ahmed Hulusi: “But as for the wrongdoers who disobey the commands, they will be firewood for Hell!”

16.Ahmed Hulusi: If they had walked upon the path (to their reality), surely We would have watered them with the water (of knowledge and gnosis).

17.Ahmed Hulusi: We would have tried them with it, to reveal their true nature. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Rabb, He will subject him to an increasing suffering!

18.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, the places of prostration are for Allah. So do not (while in the state of prostration) turn to things besides Allah!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: Whenever Abdullah (the servant of Allah – Muhammad [saw]) stands to turn to Him, they crowd around and stifle him!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: Say, “I turn only to (and ask only from) my Rabb! Never will I associate others to He who comprises my essence!”

21.Ahmed Hulusi: Say, “I can neither give you harm nor form the maturity in you to experience the reality (these are things for Allah to manifest through you)!”

22.Ahmed Hulusi: Say, “For none can save me from Allah and there is no place of refuge besides Him!”

23.Ahmed Hulusi: Except for what Allah reveals and His risalahs (the knowledge He discloses through His Rasuls)! So, whoever disobeys Allah and His Rasul, for him there is Fire in which he will abide forever!

24.Ahmed Hulusi: But when they see the thing that they have been promised (death), they will understand who the minority and the helpless are!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: Say, “I do not know whether what you have been promised is near or whether my Rabb has set for it a long period.”

26.Ahmed Hulusi: He knows the unknown! And He does not disclose His Unknown (Absolute Essence) to anyone;

27.Ahmed Hulusi: Except for a chosen-purified Rasul! And indeed, He places guards in front and behind him (the Rasul)!

28.Ahmed Hulusi: That they may know that they have conveyed the disclosed knowledge of their Rabb. He has encompassed whatever is with them and recorded everything in detail!

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Ahmed Hulusi: O covered one (Muzammil)!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Arise in the night, except for a little;

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Half of it or less,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Or increase it, and recite and contemplate upon the Quran!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, We will send upon you (make you experience in your consciousness) a heavy word!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Arising in the night gives greater perception and clarity in the evaluation of the call!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: For during the day you are occupied.

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Remember (dhikr) the qualities of the Names comprising your essence; your Rabb, and seclude yourself to Him in complete devotion.

9.Ahmed Hulusi: He is the Rabb of the east (that which shines) and the west (that which extinguishes)! There is no god, only HU! So take only him as the disposer of your affairs!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Be patient about what they say and depart from them with a pleasant departure!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Leave me (to deal alone) with those who deny in their abundance! Give them respite.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, there are chains and Hellfire with us.

13.Ahmed Hulusi: And food that gets stuck in their throats and a severe suffering!

14.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time the earth (body) and the mountains (ego-identities) will be shaken... And the mountains will become a heap of dust!

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, just as We disclosed a Rasul (guider to the reality, purifier) to Pharaoh, We have also sent a Rasul to you as a witness.

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Pharaoh disobeyed that Rasul and We seized him with a destructive seizure!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: If you are ungrateful (to the disclosed reality), how will you be protected at that time which will make the children grey-haired and old?

18.Ahmed Hulusi: The heaven will split apart there from; His promise is fulfilled!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, this is a reminder! So whoever wills may take the way (that leads) to his Rabb!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: Your Rabb knows that you arise in two-thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and so do a group of those with you. And it is Allah who determines the night and the day! (Allah) knows you will never be able to evaluate it and accepted your repentance... So, recite (comprehend) what is easy for you of the Quran! (Allah) knows that there will be among you those who are ill, and those who travel throughout the land seeking the bounty of Allah, and those who fight in the way of Allah. So, recite what is easy from it and establish salat (maintain your turning with observation), give alms and give a good loan to Allah... Whatever good you give for yourself you will find it much greater and better in the sight of Allah. Ask forgiveness of Allah! Indeed, Allah is the Ghafur, the Rahim.

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Ahmed Hulusi: O wrapped one (Muddathir);

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Arise and warn!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Realize the magnificence of your Rabb!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Purify your garments (consciousness – brain)!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Refrain from uncleanliness (duality, misevaluation)!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: And do not engage in good to acquire more (with greed)!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Be patient for your Rabb!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: When that trumpet is blown (death, resurrection);

9.Ahmed Hulusi: It will be a difficult time, indeed!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Not easy at all for those who deny (cover) the knowledge of the reality!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: So leave me (to deal) with the one I created alone;

12.Ahmed Hulusi: The one whom I granted wealth;

13.Ahmed Hulusi: And sons standing before him;

14.Ahmed Hulusi: And enabled the experience of expansive abundance!

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Yet he (greedily) wants me to increase it for him!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Never! Indeed, he is very stubborn against Our signs.

17.Ahmed Hulusi: I will subject him to an arduous uphill climb.

18.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, he reflected and decided!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: May he die (and see the reality)! How he decided!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: Again, may he die (and see the reality)! How he decided!

21.Ahmed Hulusi: Then he looked.

22.Ahmed Hulusi: Then he frowned and scowled!

23.Ahmed Hulusi: Then he turned his back and became arrogant!

24.Ahmed Hulusi: And he said, “This is nothing other than narrated words of magic!”

25.Ahmed Hulusi: “It is no other than the words of a mortal!”

26.Ahmed Hulusi: I will subject him to Saqar (painful tormenting fire).

27.Ahmed Hulusi: And what informs you of Saqar?

28.Ahmed Hulusi: (Saqar) neither lets anything remain the same, nor does it let anything be!

29.Ahmed Hulusi: It burns and blackens the (flesh of) mortals!

30.Ahmed Hulusi: Over it are nineteen!

31.Ahmed Hulusi: We have appointed only (nineteen) angels (66:6) to be the wardens of the Fire (the hell of corporeality; not a breed of humans or the jinn)... And We specified their number (as if the number nineteen is meaningful) as an (object of) trial for the disbelievers... So, those to whom a Book (knowledge) has been given can know with certainty (what is referenced by these metaphors and thus confirm the revelation of Rasulullah [saw]) and so those who believe (in the nubuwwah and risalah of Rasulullah [saw]) will increase in faith (the knowledge of certainty; ilm al-yakeen) and so those (who acquire solid knowledge) to whom a Book (knowledge) has been given (and those who have attained certainty in faith) do not fall into doubt! And so those in whose hearts there is sickness (doubt, who are devoid of healthy thought) and the disbelievers (who are veiled from and thus deny the reality) can say, “What did Allah intend to reference with this example?”... Thus Allah misguides whom He wills and guides whom He wills. Only HU knows the armies (forces) of your Rabb! This (Saqar and other metaphors) is only a reminder for people.

32.Ahmed Hulusi: No! I swear by the Moon,

33.Ahmed Hulusi: And the night, when it returns,

34.Ahmed Hulusi: And the morning, when it brightens.

35.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, it is one of the greatest things!

36.Ahmed Hulusi: A warning for the people;

37.Ahmed Hulusi: For whoever wants to go forward or stay behind.

38.Ahmed Hulusi: Everyone is bound by the results of their own deeds!

39.Ahmed Hulusi: Except for the people of the right!

40.Ahmed Hulusi: They are in Paradises... They ask,

41.Ahmed Hulusi: The guilty ones:

42.Ahmed Hulusi: “What has let you into the Saqar (the entwining fire with immense flames)?”

43.Ahmed Hulusi: They say, “We were not of those who established (actively experienced) salat!”

44.Ahmed Hulusi: “Nor did we feed the poor.”

45.Ahmed Hulusi: “And we indulged (in egotistic pleasures) with those who indulged!”

46.Ahmed Hulusi: “And we denied the time of religion (sunnatullah – that recompense will definitely be experienced for all actions)!”

47.Ahmed Hulusi: “Until finally there came to us certainty (confrontation of the reality)!”

48.Ahmed Hulusi: Then the intercession of the intercessors will not avail them.

49.Ahmed Hulusi: What is the matter with them that they turn away from the one who reminds them?

50.Ahmed Hulusi: They are like wild donkeys running about in fear!

51.Ahmed Hulusi: As though fleeing in fear from a lion!

52.Ahmed Hulusi: Perhaps each one of them desires to be given pages (of revelation)!

53.Ahmed Hulusi: No! They do not fear the eternal life to come!

54.Ahmed Hulusi: No! Indeed, it is but a reminder!

55.Ahmed Hulusi: Whoever wills will remember (and evaluate) it!

56.Ahmed Hulusi: And they cannot remember (and evaluate) unless Allah wills... He enables protection to whom He wills and forgives whom He wills.

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By the reality of the Doomsday;

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And the self-accusing self (nafs-i lawwama);

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Does man think We will not assemble his bones?

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed! We even have the power to proportion his fingertips (produce a precise reformation of his fingerprints)!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: But no! Man goes to excess despite what awaits him (life after death)!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: They ask, “When is the time of Doomsday (the experience of death)?

7.Ahmed Hulusi: When your vision is dazzled,

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And the Moon is eclipsed,

9.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the Sun and the Moon come together!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time, man will say, “Where can we escape?”

11.Ahmed Hulusi: No, there is no place of refuge (outside)!

12.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time, the permanent settlement (of every individual) is with his Rabb!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time, man will be told of all the things he put forward (accomplished) and left behind (postponed, failed to do).

14.Ahmed Hulusi: (The truth is) man is the evaluator of his own self! (Remember 17:14 “Read your book [knowledge] of life! Sufficient for you is your individual consciousness at this stage to discern the consequences of your actions.”)

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Whatever excuse he presents (it will make no difference)!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Do not repeat it with your tongue to hasten (its memorization).

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, upon Us is its compilation and its recitation.

18.Ahmed Hulusi: So when We recite it, follow its recitation!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: Then upon Us is its clarification (disclosure).

20.Ahmed Hulusi: But no! You love the immediate (the world);

21.Ahmed Hulusi: And leave the eternal life to come!

22.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time faces will shine.

23.Ahmed Hulusi: Looking at their Rabb.

24.Ahmed Hulusi: And many faces at that time will be frowning!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: They (with frowning faces) will feel their backs breaking...

26.Ahmed Hulusi: No! When the life reaches the collarbones;

27.Ahmed Hulusi: “Who will save him from death?”

28.Ahmed Hulusi: He will know with certainty that it is the time of the known separation!

29.Ahmed Hulusi: And the feet will be intertwined!

30.Ahmed Hulusi: To your Rabb will be the dispatch at that time!

31.Ahmed Hulusi: For he neither confirmed, nor established salat (turned to his Rabb)...

32.Ahmed Hulusi: But denied and turned away!

33.Ahmed Hulusi: And then went back to his people full of pride and arrogance.

34.Ahmed Hulusi: Deserving you are, deserving you are!

35.Ahmed Hulusi: Again, deserving you are, yes deserving you are!

36.Ahmed Hulusi: Does man think he will be left to his own accord?

37.Ahmed Hulusi: Was he not once a drop of sperm?

38.Ahmed Hulusi: Which then became a clot (genetic structure), and (Allah) created him and proportioned him (according to his creational purpose).

39.Ahmed Hulusi: And made of him two partners, the male (consciousness – active energy) and the female (the body – the receptive energy).

40.Ahmed Hulusi: Is this (the system and order of Allah who made all of this) not Qadir to give life to the dead?

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Has there not been a time, when man was not a thing even mentioned? (Man was not yet manifest; he was the unmanifest within the dimension of the Names)!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, We created man from a mixture of (genetic heritage) sperm and made him as one who perceives and evaluates.

3.Ahmed Hulusi: We showed him the way (to use his intellect and believe). He will either be grateful (and evaluate his Rabb) or be a denier (of the Truth)!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, We have prepared for those who deny the knowledge of the reality chains (environmental conditionings and value judgments) and shackles (the ties of corporeality) and a blaze (of fire – burning).

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup whose mixture is Kafur (a drink that strengthens the heart).

6.Ahmed Hulusi: (That drink) is an endless spring that they (the servants of Allah) will cause to gush forth and flow.

7.Ahmed Hulusi: They (the righteous) keep their vows and they fear a day whose evil spreads far and wide!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: They feed the needy, the orphans and captives out of their love for Him.

9.Ahmed Hulusi: Saying, “We feed you for the sake of Allah... We ask of you neither a return nor thanks.”

10.Ahmed Hulusi: “We fear from our Rabb a wrathful and intense time.”

11.Ahmed Hulusi: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that time and give them brightness and joy.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: And the respite for their patience will be Paradise and silk.

13.Ahmed Hulusi: They will lean on lounges therein and see neither the (burning) sun nor the (freezing) cold (meaning bodily senses will not be valid in that dimension of life).

14.Ahmed Hulusi: The shades will be near above them, and its fruits (gnosis) will be lowered.

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Silver cups and crystal vessels will circulate among them.

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Silver and crystal cups of which they have determined the amount.

17.Ahmed Hulusi: And they will be given a cup whose mixture is of ginger.

18.Ahmed Hulusi: A fountain named ‘Salsabeel’.

19.Ahmed Hulusi: Young servants who are immortal will circulate among them... You will think they are scattered pearls when you see them!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: And wherever you look you will (only) see bounty and a great sovereignty.

21.Ahmed Hulusi: And they will be in garments made of fine silk and brocade, adorned with silver bracelets... And their Rabb will have given them pure wine (the euphoric state caused by the exposure to the reality...). (Note that all these descriptions pertaining to Paradise are similes and figurative representations as mentioned in the verses 13:35 and 47:15. This should not be forgotten.)

22.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, this is your reward (the results of your deeds)! Your faithful practices have been duly appreciated!

23.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, it is Us, yes Us, who revealed the Quran to you (manifested it through you part by part)!

24.Ahmed Hulusi: So, be patient for the command of your Rabb and do not follow any from among them who rebels or covers the reality in persistent denial.

25.Ahmed Hulusi: Remember (dhikr) the name of your Rabb by morning and by night!

26.Ahmed Hulusi: And prostrate to him in a part of the night; glorify (tasbih) Him extensively during the night.

27.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, these ones love the world in front of them without considering the intense hardship of the time that is to come after it.

28.Ahmed Hulusi: We created them and strengthened their ties... And We will replace them with their like whenever We will.

29.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, this is a reminder (of the reality)! So, whoever wills may take the path to his Rabb.

30.Ahmed Hulusi: You cannot will unless Allah wills (your will is Allah’s will)! Indeed, Allah is the Aleem, the Hakim.

31.Ahmed Hulusi: He includes whom He wills to His grace. As for the wrongdoers, He has prepared an intense suffering for them.

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By those disclosed one after another;

2.Ahmed Hulusi: That blow about violently;

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Who bring to life and cause to rise;

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Who choose and separate;

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And those who disclose the reminder (the forces that manifest in consciousness; the Exalted Assembly [Mala-i Ala]. The word ‘ilqa’ or ‘liqa’ [disclosure] is like ‘nafh’ [breath] in that it goes outward from within; it is an explicit projection experienced in the consciousness. In the sequence: the Hidden [Reflection of Attributes], the Secret [Reflection of Names], the Spirit [Fuad: Reflectors of the Names], the Heart [Consciousness] and the Self [Identity – Individual consciousness]. It looks to the reflections from the spirit to the heart. ‘Vicegerent’ [Khalifa] – ‘Man’ is the totality of all of these states or one who incorporates all of these states is called a true ‘Man’).

6.Ahmed Hulusi: To excuse (pardon misdeeds) or to warn.

7.Ahmed Hulusi: What you are promised will definitely be fulfilled!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: When the stars are extinguished,

9.Ahmed Hulusi: And the sky is split open,

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And the mountains are blown away,

11.Ahmed Hulusi: And the Rasuls (not the Nabis) take their new positions.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: For which day were they postponed?

13.Ahmed Hulusi: For the time of sorting!

14.Ahmed Hulusi: And do you know what the time of sorting is?

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to those who denied (life after death) at that time!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not destroy the former people?

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Then We will make the later ones follow them (they too will be destroyed).

18.Ahmed Hulusi: Thus do We deal with the guilty!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not create you from a simple water?

21.Ahmed Hulusi: We formed it in a safe place (the womb),

22.Ahmed Hulusi: For a known time!

23.Ahmed Hulusi: Thus We determined it! And excellent determiners We are!

24.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not make the earth a place of gathering?

26.Ahmed Hulusi: For the living and the dead!

27.Ahmed Hulusi: We formed therein elevated (grand, majestic) mountains that are firm and made you drink sweet water.

28.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

29.Ahmed Hulusi: Proceed to that which you denied!

30.Ahmed Hulusi: Proceed to the shadow of the trident (let your faith in the trinity [God-the Son and the Holy Spirit] save you now)!

31.Ahmed Hulusi: It will neither shade you (from the Fire) nor save you from the blazing flame (different sensations of burning)!

32.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, it shoots sparks as big as palaces!

33.Ahmed Hulusi: Sparks like giant golden ropes!

34.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

35.Ahmed Hulusi: This is the day they shall not speak.

36.Ahmed Hulusi: Nor will they be given permission to present excuses.

37.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

38.Ahmed Hulusi: This is the time of sorting! We have brought you and the former ones together.

39.Ahmed Hulusi: So, if you have a trick, try your trick against Me now!

40.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

41.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, the protected ones will be among shades and springs.

42.Ahmed Hulusi: With every fruit they desire.

43.Ahmed Hulusi: “Eat and drink with joy as the result of your deeds!”

44.Ahmed Hulusi: Thus We respite the doers of good (in whose observation there is none but the Truth).

45.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

46.Ahmed Hulusi: “Eat and enjoy yourself for a little (in this world)... Indeed, you are guilty!”

47.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

48.Ahmed Hulusi: And when they are told, “Bow,” they do not bow!

49.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers at that time!

50.Ahmed Hulusi: Then in what word will they believe after (this big news given by the Quran)?

1.Ahmed Hulusi: What are they questioning?

2.Ahmed Hulusi: The mighty news (regarding life after death)?

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Over this, they are in disagreement.

4.Ahmed Hulusi: But no! Soon (when they die) they will know (that it is not like what they think)!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Again, no! Soon they will know (it is not like what they think)!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not make the earth (the body) a cradle (a temporary place in which you can grow and develop yourselves)?

7.Ahmed Hulusi: And the mountains (the organs in the body) as stakes.

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And created you as partners (consciousness – body).

9.Ahmed Hulusi: And made sleep a means for rest.

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And the night a blanket.

11.Ahmed Hulusi: And made the day for livelihood.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: And constructed seven strong (heavens) above you (the system with seven orbits – the dimension of consciousness).

13.Ahmed Hulusi: And a luminous lamp (Sun – intellect).

14.Ahmed Hulusi: And disclosed pouring water from the rain clouds.

15.Ahmed Hulusi: So that We may produce therein grain and vegetation.

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Gardens within gardens!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, that time (of sorting and separating) is an appointed time.

18.Ahmed Hulusi: The Horn will be blown at that time and you will come forth in groups.

19.Ahmed Hulusi: The heaven will open and become gateways (consciousness will be opened to perception without the bodily senses).

20.Ahmed Hulusi: And mountains will be made to vanish as if they were a mirage (the limitations of the organs are removed).

21.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, Hell has become a place of passage (everyone will pass from it).

22.Ahmed Hulusi: A place of settlement for the transgressors (the wrongdoers who failed to protect themselves according to the sunnatullah).

23.Ahmed Hulusi: To remain therein for a very long time!

24.Ahmed Hulusi: They will not taste therein any coolness or a delightful drink!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: Only boiling water and pus!

26.Ahmed Hulusi: As the direct result of their deeds!

27.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, they did not expect (to be called to) account (for their lives)!

28.Ahmed Hulusi: They persistently denied Our signs within their beings!

29.Ahmed Hulusi: But We have recorded everything in detail!

30.Ahmed Hulusi: So taste it, never We will increase you in anything except suffering!

31.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, there is an attainment for the protected ones.

32.Ahmed Hulusi: Gardens and grapevines... (Remember that all descriptions pertaining to Paradise are metaphoric expressions.)

33.Ahmed Hulusi: Magnificent partners of equal age! (Magnificently capacitated bodies bearing the qualities of that dimension of existence, without the concept of gender, formed to manifest the qualities of the Names emanating from the essence of the individual consciousness... Note again, without any differentiation of gender! Allah knows best.)

34.Ahmed Hulusi: And cups that are full!

35.Ahmed Hulusi: They will hear neither baseless speech therein nor any falsehood.

36.Ahmed Hulusi: As respite from your Rabb, an endowment for their deeds!

37.Ahmed Hulusi: He is the Rabb of the heavens, the earth and everything in between; He is the Rahman! The One of whom no one has the authority to speak.

38.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time the Spirit (the single reality of the Names that manifests in the consciousness of all humans) and the angels will stand in rows. None will be able to speak, except for whom the Rahman has given permission (allowed his natural disposition). And he will speak the truth.

39.Ahmed Hulusi: This is the time of the Truth! Then, whoever wills may take a way to his Rabb!

40.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, we have warned you of a close suffering (caused by the realization of the Truth through the experience of death)! On that day, man will observe what his hands have put forth, and those who denied the knowledge of the reality will say “Oh, how I wish I was made of dust!”

79.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Drag Forth, Soul-snatchers, Those Who Pulled Out

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By the intensely powerful (force; Mars),

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And the (force) that takes with ease (Sun),

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And the (forces) that swim (in their orbits; Saturn – Jupiter),

4.Ahmed Hulusi: And the (forces) that race ahead (Mercury – Venus),

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And the administrators of the command (the forces that reveal; the Moon). (That these verses denote the planets is the construal of Hasan al-Basri and Imam Razi, a perspective I also share.)

6.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time the convulsion (of death; earthquake) will convulse.

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Followed by a subsequent one (resurrection; commencement of a new life with the new spirit-body).

8.Ahmed Hulusi: The minds (of some) will be shocked at that time!

9.Ahmed Hulusi: Their vision will be confounded and crushed!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Yet still they say, “Will we really be returned to our former state (back to life, after having become dust); is resurrection really true?”

11.Ahmed Hulusi: “Even after we have become decayed and scattered bones?”

12.Ahmed Hulusi: “That, then, (the continuation of life in this state) will be a return in loss.”

13.Ahmed Hulusi: Whereas, it is but one command!

14.Ahmed Hulusi: And behold they will instantly find themselves on an open expanse!

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Did the news of Moses reach you?

16.Ahmed Hulusi: How his Rabb called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa:

17.Ahmed Hulusi: “Go to Pharaoh! Indeed, he has transgressed!”

18.Ahmed Hulusi: “And say, ‘How about becoming cleansed and purified?’”

19.Ahmed Hulusi: “How about I guide you to your Rabb? You will be in awe (of His might)!”

20.Ahmed Hulusi: Then he showed him the great miracle!

21.Ahmed Hulusi: But (Pharaoh) denied and rebelled.

22.Ahmed Hulusi: Then turned his back and ran.

23.Ahmed Hulusi: Then he gathered (his people) and called out:

24.Ahmed Hulusi: “I am your Rabb, the most supreme!” (Pharaoh, who had attained the ancient knowledge of the reality, chose to use this in favor of his bodily existence and bodily pursuits rather than using it to observe the comprehensiveness of consciousness upon existence, and thus fell to the state of the inciting self. This is why, rather than conveying the knowledge of the reality to him and calling him to believe in Allah, Moses warns him by calling him to believe in the ‘Rabb of the worlds.’ In other words, he invites him to believe in the Names, which are manifest throughout, and administer the entire existence, rather than experiencing his understanding of this unity through his corporeality.)

25.Ahmed Hulusi: So Allah seized him with an exemplary suffering of the eternal life to come and what is before it (the world).

26.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, there is a lesson in this for those who are in awe!

27.Ahmed Hulusi: Is your creation harder or the creation of the heaven? (Which Allah also) constructed!

28.Ahmed Hulusi: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it (formed it with the qualities to fulfill its function).

29.Ahmed Hulusi: He darkened its night and brightened its day.

30.Ahmed Hulusi: Then He spread the earth and furnished it.

31.Ahmed Hulusi: Then extracted its water and its pasture.

32.Ahmed Hulusi: And the mountains, He set them firmly as if anchored.

33.Ahmed Hulusi: So that you and your cattle (animals) may benefit from it.

34.Ahmed Hulusi: But when the overwhelming calamity (the experience of death) begins,

35.Ahmed Hulusi: Man will remember at that time the results of his deeds!

36.Ahmed Hulusi: And Hell will be (openly) exposed to those who see (without the limitation of the eye)!

37.Ahmed Hulusi: For he who transgressed without bounds,

38.Ahmed Hulusi: And chose to live in pursuit of worldly pleasures;

39.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, the place (state) of burning will be his abode!

40.Ahmed Hulusi: But as for he who feared the position of his Rabb and protected himself from things whose results will be useless in the eternal life,

41.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, Paradise will be his very abode.

42.Ahmed Hulusi: They ask you about that Hour: when is its arrival?

43.Ahmed Hulusi: But who are you to have this knowledge?

44.Ahmed Hulusi: To your Rabb is its finality.

45.Ahmed Hulusi: You are only a warner to those who are in awe of it!

46.Ahmed Hulusi: The day they see it, it will be as though they had not remained (in the world), except for a time of sunset or twilight.

1.Ahmed Hulusi: He frowned and turned away!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: When the blind man approached him!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: How do you know, perhaps he might be purified!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Or perhaps he is going to contemplate on the reminder and that remembrance is going to benefit him!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: As for he who thinks himself without need...

6.Ahmed Hulusi: You give attention to him!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: But what is it to you if he is not purified!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Whereas the one who comes to you with a thirst for knowledge!

9.Ahmed Hulusi: He is in awe!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Yet you do not give your attention to him!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: No, indeed, it (the Quran) is a reminder.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: So whoever wills shall remember it!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: It is recorded in honored records,

14.Ahmed Hulusi: And exalted and completely purified!

15.Ahmed Hulusi: By the hands (forces) of scribes (recording angels).

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Noble (dignified, supreme) and dutiful,

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to man! May he die (and see the reality)! How he denies!

18.Ahmed Hulusi: From what did He create him?

19.Ahmed Hulusi: He made him from a sperm-drop, and formed his nature!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: Then eased his way.

21.Ahmed Hulusi: Then killed and placed him in the grave (body).

22.Ahmed Hulusi: Then, when He wills, He will resurrect him from his grave (body).

23.Ahmed Hulusi: But no! He has not yet fulfilled what He commanded him (he has not duly fulfilled his vicegerency).

24.Ahmed Hulusi: Let man look at what he eats!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: We poured that water and made it flow in abundance.

26.Ahmed Hulusi: And We split open the earth (and thus),

27.Ahmed Hulusi: We caused sprouts to grow therein.

28.Ahmed Hulusi: Grapes and fresh plants,

29.Ahmed Hulusi: Olives and dates,

30.Ahmed Hulusi: Dense gardens of large trees,

31.Ahmed Hulusi: Fruits and pastures,

32.Ahmed Hulusi: For the benefit of you and your cattle (animals).

33.Ahmed Hulusi: When that frightening blast is heard,

34.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time, man will flee from his brother,

35.Ahmed Hulusi: And from his mother and father,

36.Ahmed Hulusi: And from his wife and sons!

37.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time, each will be to his own!

38.Ahmed Hulusi: (Some) faces that day will be bright,

39.Ahmed Hulusi: Laughing, rejoicing at the good news!

40.Ahmed Hulusi: And (some) faces that day will be covered in dust!

41.Ahmed Hulusi: Covered in darkness!

42.Ahmed Hulusi: They, the falsifiers (who are inclined towards falsity), are the very deniers of the knowledge of the reality!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: When the Sun is wrapped up (when the mind loses its power in the sight of the reality),

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And the stars are darkened (thought processes cease – ideas shed no light),

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And the mountains are removed (the organs stop working),

4.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the she-camels (objects of wealth and status) are neglected and (worldly values are) abandoned,

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the beasts are gathered (animalistic senses lose their power),

6.Ahmed Hulusi: And the seas begin to boil (information obtained via conditionings flame up and boil away in sight of the reality),

7.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the souls are paired (individual consciousnesses are paired with their new spirit bodies),

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And the female infant who was buried alive is asked,

9.Ahmed Hulusi: “For what sin she was killed?”

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the recorded pages are made public,

11.Ahmed Hulusi: And the sky is ripped away (when the mind loses its reasoning power),

12.Ahmed Hulusi: And Hell is ignited and set ablaze (the fire of remorse is flared up),

13.Ahmed Hulusi: And Paradise is brought near,

14.Ahmed Hulusi: Every soul (individual consciousness) will know what it has prepared (apprehend the consequences of his deeds during his life in the biological body).

15.Ahmed Hulusi: I swear by ‘al-Hunnas’ (the stars that are not observable during the day due to sunlight),

16.Ahmed Hulusi: And by al-Jawar and al-Qunnas (the planets that run their course and those that orbit near the constellations),

17.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the night as it closes in,

18.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the morning that you breathe in,

19.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, it is the word (conveyed by) a noble Rasul;

20.Ahmed Hulusi: A powerful (Rasul)! Secure in the sight of the owner of the Throne!

21.Ahmed Hulusi: Obeyed there (in the heaven) and trustworthy.

22.Ahmed Hulusi: Your companion (Muhammad [saw]) is not possessed!

23.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, he observed him in the clear horizon!

24.Ahmed Hulusi: He does not withhold (the knowledge of) the unseen!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: And it is not the word of Satan, the cursed (distanced from the reality)!

26.Ahmed Hulusi: So, where are you going (by leaving the Quran)?

27.Ahmed Hulusi: It is only a reminder to the worlds (humans)!

28.Ahmed Hulusi: For those who want to live by the Truth!

29.Ahmed Hulusi: You cannot will unless Allah, the Rabb of the worlds, wills!

82.SurahEnglishNames: The Cleaving, The Cleaving Asunder, Bursting Apart

1.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the sky is split apart,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And the planets are scattered away,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And the seas boil and erupt,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: And the spirits are removed from their worlds (realize the universal reality);

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Every soul shall know what it has prepared (aforetime) and what it has failed to do (neglected, left for later).

6.Ahmed Hulusi: O man! How did you dare to (be ungrateful to your essential reality) your Rabb, the Generous One?

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Who created you (manifested you), formed you (with a brain, an individual consciousness and a spirit) and balanced you (the work process of your brain, consciousness and spirit)!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Whatever form (manifestation of Names) He willed for you, He configured your composition accordingly.

9.Ahmed Hulusi: But no (it is not like what you think)! Rather, you are in denial of your religion (the system by which you live)!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, there are over you recorders (who record all of your thoughts from your brain to your spirit),

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Magnificent noble scribes (forces)!

12.Ahmed Hulusi: They know whatever you do.

13.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, the righteous will be in Paradises of pleasure.

14.Ahmed Hulusi: While the falsifiers (who strayed from the Truth) will be in Hell (Fire).

15.Ahmed Hulusi: They will be subjected to it at the time when the commands of religion are applied!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: They are in a state of constant observation of Hell!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Do you know what the Day of Religion is?

18.Ahmed Hulusi: So then, do you know what the Day of Religion is?

19.Ahmed Hulusi: A time when no one can do anything for another! The judgment at that time belongs to Allah (there is nothing the person can do other than live the consequences of his deeds)!

83.SurahEnglishNames: Defrauding, The Defrauders, The Cheats, Cheating

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to those who do not measure and scale justly!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: They take their right from the people in full;

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Yet (when it comes to giving the right of others) they reduce the measure and give them less!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Do they not think they will be resurrected (immediately after death)?

5.Ahmed Hulusi: For a tremendous time.

6.Ahmed Hulusi: A time when mankind will stand before the Rabb of the worlds!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: No (never)! Indeed, the record of the falsifiers (who have strayed from the Truth) is in the sijjeen!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And what informs you of the sijjeen?

9.Ahmed Hulusi: It is a non-erasable record!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to the deniers (of sunnatullah) at that time!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Who denied their time of religion (the time of recompense; when the consequences of all deeds are automatically experienced)!

12.Ahmed Hulusi: It is only every guilty transgressor who denies it!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: When he is informed of Our signs he says, “The legends of the old!”

14.Ahmed Hulusi: No (never)! Rather, the products of their deeds have covered their consciousness (like rust).

15.Ahmed Hulusi: No! Indeed, that day they are veiled from their Rabb!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Then, indeed, they will enter the Fire.

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Then they will be told, “This is the thing you denied.”

18.Ahmed Hulusi: No... Indeed, the book of the righteous is in the iliyyun.

19.Ahmed Hulusi: And what informs you of the iliyyun?

20.Ahmed Hulusi: It is a non-erasable record!

21.Ahmed Hulusi: Witnessed by the muqarriboon (those who have attained the state of divine closeness).

22.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, the righteous will be in Paradises of pleasure.

23.Ahmed Hulusi: On lounges, observing...

24.Ahmed Hulusi: You will see the radiance of pleasure on their faces.

25.Ahmed Hulusi: They will be made to drink from a sealed (protected) and purified wine.

26.Ahmed Hulusi: The last of it is musk... So let those who compete, compete for this!

27.Ahmed Hulusi: Its mixture is of Tasneem.

28.Ahmed Hulusi: A spring from which those who have attained divine closeness (the muqarriboon) drink!

29.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, the guilty used to laugh at the believers.

30.Ahmed Hulusi: When they saw them they used to blink their eyes and mock them.

31.Ahmed Hulusi: And when they returned to their people (families and friends) they used to return rejoicing.

32.Ahmed Hulusi: And when they saw (the believers) they used to say, “Indeed, these ones have surely gone astray.”

33.Ahmed Hulusi: Whereas they were not sent to be their guardians over them (the believers)!

34.Ahmed Hulusi: So, today the believers are laughing at the veiled ones who denied the Truth!

35.Ahmed Hulusi: Upon lounges, observing...

36.Ahmed Hulusi: So, are the deniers of the reality thus living the consequences of their deeds?

1.Ahmed Hulusi: When the heaven is split open,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And attends to its Rabb in submission – which is the Truth!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the earth is extended and spread out,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: And it throws out what is within it and empties itself,

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And attends to its Rabb in submission!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: O man! Indeed, you are striving towards your Rabb! You will reach Him in the end!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Whoever is given his record, formed on his right side,

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Will be called to an easy account,

9.Ahmed Hulusi: And will transform into the composition of the people of Paradise!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: But he who is given his book from behind,

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Will call out, “Death be my savior!”

12.Ahmed Hulusi: And will be subject to the (blazing) Fire!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, he used to rejoice among his like...

14.Ahmed Hulusi: He thought he would never return (to his Rabb).

15.Ahmed Hulusi: But no! Indeed, his Rabb was Basir within him!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: I swear by the twilight,

17.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the night and what it carries,

18.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the full moon,

19.Ahmed Hulusi: That you will certainly change dimensions and transform into bodies befitting those dimensions!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: So, this being the case, what is the matter with them that they do not believe?

21.Ahmed Hulusi: And when the Quran is recited to them, they do not prostrate (remove their ego-identities and submit themselves to the Reality)? (This is a verse of prostration.)

22.Ahmed Hulusi: And those who deny the knowledge of the reality further deny!

23.Ahmed Hulusi: But Allah knows better what they collect and keep within themselves (their thoughts and beliefs).

24.Ahmed Hulusi: So, give them the news of their severe suffering!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: Except for those who believe and fulfill the requisites of faith! For them there is uninterrupted reward.

85.SurahEnglishNames: The Mansions of the Stars, The Constellations

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By the space containing the constellations!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And the promised time!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the witness and the witnessed!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Destroyed were the people of the trench...

5.Ahmed Hulusi: In the fire full of fuel.

6.Ahmed Hulusi: The fire around which they sat...

7.Ahmed Hulusi: And they were witnesses to what they were doing to the believers!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And they avenged them (the believers) only because they believed in Allah, the Aziz, the Hamid.

9.Ahmed Hulusi: To whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth! Allah is witness to everything!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, those who torture the believing men and believing women and do not repent, there is the suffering of Hell for them, and there is a burning suffering for them.

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, those who believe and fulfill the requisites of faith, there are Paradises for them underneath which rivers flow... This is the great attainment!

12.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, the seizure of your Rabb is intense!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: It is HU who originates (manifests) and then returns it (recreates)!

14.Ahmed Hulusi: He is the Ghafur, the Wadud.

15.Ahmed Hulusi: The owner of the Throne, the Majeed (the Majestic).

16.Ahmed Hulusi: The doer of what He wills!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Did the news of those armies reach you?

18.Ahmed Hulusi: Those (who destroyed) Pharaoh and Thamud!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: No! Those who disbelieve in the knowledge of the reality are in denial.

20.Ahmed Hulusi: But Allah encompassed them from (within their depths)!

21.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, this is an honored Quran.

22.Ahmed Hulusi: In a preserved tablet (Lawh-i Mahfuz; the unmanifest knowledge of Allah and sunnatullah)!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By the sky and the Tariq,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Do you know the Tariq?

3.Ahmed Hulusi: It is the piercing star (pulsar)!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: There is no soul over which there is no guardian (observer – protector).

5.Ahmed Hulusi: So, let man look to see from what he was created!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: He was created from an ejected fluid (sperm).

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Emerging from between the hip (of the male) and the pelvis (of the female).

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, He is Qadir to return him (to his origin)!

9.Ahmed Hulusi: At that time all secrets will be exposed and known.

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Then there will be no power or helper for him!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the sky with its orbiters,

12.Ahmed Hulusi: And the earth cracked open,

13.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, it (the Quran) is a word that separates falsity from the Truth;

14.Ahmed Hulusi: It has not come as a joke!

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, they are planning a plot.

16.Ahmed Hulusi: And I am responding to their plot with My plot!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: So, give respite to those who deny the knowledge of the reality; give them a little time.

87.SurahEnglishNames: The Most High, Glory to your Lord in the Highest

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Glorify (tasbih) the most exalted name of your Rabb (experience the exaltedness of the reality that comprises your essence within your depths)!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Who created (the body) and proportioned it,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And who determined and guided (to manifest His perfection),

4.Ahmed Hulusi: And who formed the pasture (as place of benefit for them),

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Then made it black stubble (corpses to be cast into the earth).

6.Ahmed Hulusi: We will make you READ and you shall not forget!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Except for what Allah wills... Indeed, He knows what is manifest and what is concealed.

8.Ahmed Hulusi: We are going to ease you toward ease!

9.Ahmed Hulusi: So remind, if reminding benefits!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: He who is in awe shall remember and contemplate!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: While the most unfortunate one shall flee from it!

12.Ahmed Hulusi: He (the most unfortunate one) will be subject to the greatest Fire (falling eternally far from Allah)!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: Then he will neither die therein (be saved) nor live (with the knowledge of the reality)!

14.Ahmed Hulusi: The purified and the refined have attained true success!

15.Ahmed Hulusi: And he who remembers the name of his Rabb and establishes(experiences) salat has attained true success!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: But you prefer the life of the world (the lowest state of existence)!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: When the life after (the dimension of power and consciousness) is much better and more lasting.

18.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, this (knowledge of the reality) was also in the previously disclosed knowledge.

19.Ahmed Hulusi: The knowledge disclosed by Abraham and Moses!

88.SurahEnglishNames: The Overwhelming, The Overwhelming Calamity, The Pall

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Did the news reach you of the Ghashiya (the overwhelming event that wraps and covers people – Doomsday)?

2.Ahmed Hulusi: (Some) faces that day will look down in shame!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Having worked hard (complying with customs, traditions and customary practices of worship) and exhausted for nothing!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: They (those faces) will be subject to an intense fire!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: They will be made to drink from a boiling spring!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: And there will be no food for them, except for a poisonous thorny plant,

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Which will neither nourish them nor appease their hunger.

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And many faces that day will show signs of pleasure.

9.Ahmed Hulusi: They will be pleased with the results of their (duly spent) efforts!

10.Ahmed Hulusi: In an elevated Paradise!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: They will hear no baseless speech therein.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: Within a (continually) flowing spring (of knowledge and power),

13.Ahmed Hulusi: Couches raised high,

14.Ahmed Hulusi: And cups put in place,

15.Ahmed Hulusi: And cushions lined up (behind them),

16.Ahmed Hulusi: And carpets spread (beneath them),

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Do they not look at the camels (rain clouds), how they are created?

18.Ahmed Hulusi: And (do they not look at) the sky, how it has been raised (how space has been formed)!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: And (do they not look at) the mountains, how they have been set!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: And (do they not look at) the earth, how it has been furnished!

21.Ahmed Hulusi: So remind! For you are a reminder (you have been disclosed to remind them of their essential reality)!

22.Ahmed Hulusi: You are not a controller and imposer over them!

23.Ahmed Hulusi: But whoever turns away and covers (denies and refuses to see the reality),

24.Ahmed Hulusi: Allah will subject him to the greatest suffering!

25.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, to Us is their return,

26.Ahmed Hulusi: And it is up to Us to make them live the consequences of their deeds!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: I swear by the dawn,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And by ten nights,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: By the even and the odd,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the night when it passes...

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Is there not in this a (sufficient) oath for a man of reason?

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Did you not see how your Rabb dealt with Aad (the people of Hud),

7.Ahmed Hulusi: And Iram, the (city) with lofty pillars?

8.Ahmed Hulusi: The like of which has never been created in the land!

9.Ahmed Hulusi: (What did your Rabb do) to Thamud (the people of Salih), who carved out the rocks in the valley?

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And Pharaoh, the owner of the tall stakes (the pyramids).

11.Ahmed Hulusi: They are those who lived egocentrically in the land and transgressed,

12.Ahmed Hulusi: And increased corruption therein!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: So your Rabb struck them the whip of suffering.

14.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, your Rabb is in complete observation.

15.Ahmed Hulusi: But as for man, when his Rabb tries him and is generous to him and bestows His bounties upon him, he says, “My Rabb has honored me, and preferred me (and becomes spoilt).”

16.Ahmed Hulusi: But when He tries him with an affliction and restricts his provision, he (impatiently) says, “My Rabb has debased and humiliated me.”

17.Ahmed Hulusi: No! No, you do not honor the orphan!

18.Ahmed Hulusi: And you do not encourage each other to feed the needy.

19.Ahmed Hulusi: And you consume inheritance, devouring it all at once!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: And you love wealth and you collect and hoard.

21.Ahmed Hulusi: No (do not do this)! When the earth is crushed into pieces,

22.Ahmed Hulusi: And (with death) the angels (forces) line up in ranks with (the command of your) Rabb,

23.Ahmed Hulusi: It is then that Hell will be brought (to enclose the earth)! And man at that time will remember and think, but what benefit to him will the remembrance be (when he no longer has a body – brain with which he can develop his spirit)?

24.Ahmed Hulusi: He will say “I wish I had done beneficial things (raised my consciousness level to observe the Names).”

25.Ahmed Hulusi: And nothing can cause him more suffering at that time than the suffering by Him!

26.Ahmed Hulusi: And nothing can bind him like the binding of Him!

27.Ahmed Hulusi: “O the peaceful self (nafs-i mutmainna; one who has reached a state of contentment in experiencing the reality)!”

28.Ahmed Hulusi: Turn to your Rabb (your essence) as the pleased self (nafs-i radhiya) and the pleasing self (nafs-i mardhiya) (as consciousness, experiencing the beauty of observation and providence)!”

29.Ahmed Hulusi: “And enter among my servants (who continue their functions having annihilated their ‘identities’ – their assumed selves – to the bliss of nonexistence)!”

30.Ahmed Hulusi: “And enter my Paradise!”

1.Ahmed Hulusi: I swear by this city (the world in which I live)...

2.Ahmed Hulusi: That you are free of restriction herein!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And (I swear) by the One who gives birth (to man) and that which is born of him,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: We have certainly created man in stages of difficulty!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Does he now think that none can overpower him?

6.Ahmed Hulusi: He says, “I have spent much wealth.”

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Does he think nobody can see him?

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not form two eyes for him?

9.Ahmed Hulusi: A tongue and two lips...

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And showed him the two ways (of falsity and Truth)!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: But he did not have (the courage) to climb that steep hill!

12.Ahmed Hulusi: Do you know what that steep hill is?

13.Ahmed Hulusi: It is to liberate from slavery (to free consciousness from its enslavement to the body)!

14.Ahmed Hulusi: Or to feed another while hungry!

15.Ahmed Hulusi: (To feed) an orphan of near relation.

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Or to feed the impoverished one who is in distress.

17.Ahmed Hulusi: And then to be of those who believe and advise patience and mercy to one another.

18.Ahmed Hulusi: These are the people of the right (the fortunate ones).

19.Ahmed Hulusi: But those who deny Our signs, they are the people of the left (the unfortunate ones).

20.Ahmed Hulusi: They are enclosed and trapped in Fire!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By the Sun and its light (the time the sun starts to illuminate the earth);

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the Moon when it follows it,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the day that reveals it,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the night that covers it,

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the heaven and the One who constructed it,

6.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the earth and the One who spread it,

7.Ahmed Hulusi: By the self (the individual consciousness; identity) and the One who proportioned it (formed the brain);

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Then inspired it as to what will lead it astray from the Truth and the system, and how to protect itself...

9.Ahmed Hulusi: He who purifies (his consciousness) has succeeded.

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And he who buries and hides (his consciousness by pursuing unconscious impulses) has lost.

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Thamud (the people of Salih) denied (their reality and the system) by refusing the Nabi.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: When the most unfortunate of them rose up,

13.Ahmed Hulusi: The Rasul of Allah said, “Protect the she-camel of Allah, and her right to drink!”

14.Ahmed Hulusi: But they denied (the Rasul of Allah) and savagely killed her (the shecamel). So their Rabb destroyed them for their sins and leveled their city to the ground.

15.Ahmed Hulusi: The consequence of this does not frighten Allah!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: I swear by the night when it covers over,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the day as it radiantly appears,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the One who created the male and the female (active and receptive energies),

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, your efforts are of different intentions.

5.Ahmed Hulusi: He who gives (both of himself, i.e. his constructed identity, and from himself, i.e. from that which is valuable for him) and protects himself,

6.Ahmed Hulusi: And believes in (confirms) the Most Beautiful (Names) (to be his essential reality),

7.Ahmed Hulusi: We will ease him towards ease.

8.Ahmed Hulusi: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need (for purification and protection),

9.Ahmed Hulusi: And denies the Most Beautiful (to be his essential reality),

10.Ahmed Hulusi: We will ease him toward the most difficult (to a life veiled from the knowledge of the reality and the sunnatullah)!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: And when he falls (into Hell) his wealth will be of no avail to him.

12.Ahmed Hulusi: Upon Us is guidance to the reality.

13.Ahmed Hulusi: And indeed, to Us belongs the eternal life to come and the present one!

14.Ahmed Hulusi: I have warned you of a blazing Fire.

15.Ahmed Hulusi: Only the most unfortunate will be subjected to it.

16.Ahmed Hulusi: Who had denied and turned away (from his essence)!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: But the one who sought protection will be kept away from it.

18.Ahmed Hulusi: The one who spends his wealth on others to become purified (rather than hoarding),

19.Ahmed Hulusi: And he does this not for a return (nor as the return for anything)!

20.Ahmed Hulusi: Only for the sake of the countenance of his Rabb, the Most High!

21.Ahmed Hulusi: And indeed, he will be pleased!

93.SurahEnglishNames: The Morning Hours, The Early Hours, Morning Bright

1.Ahmed Hulusi: I swear by the morning light (when the sun starts to illuminate the earth; adDhuha),

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And by the night, the time of tranquility.

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Your Rabb has not forsaken you nor is He displeased with you!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Surely, the eternal life to come is better for you than the present one.

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Your Rabb is going to give to you and you are going to be well pleased!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Did He not find you an orphan and gave you refuge?

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Did He not find you lost (unaware of your essential reality) and guided you to the reality?

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And did We not find you poor (faqr, in nothingness) and made you rich (with infinity – baqa, i.e.)? (Did we not make you a servant of the Ghani? Did we not enrich and emancipate you?)

9.Ahmed Hulusi: So, do not look down on the orphan,

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And do not scold the one who inquires and wants!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Express the blessings of your Rabb!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not expand your breast (broaden your capabilities)?

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not remove your burden (of your identity) from you (by revealing the reality to you)?

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Which had weighed (heavy) upon your back (overburdened you)!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Did We not exalt your remembrance (by reminding you of and making you live by the reality)?

5.Ahmed Hulusi: So, surely with every hardship there is ease.

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Yes, surely with every hardship there is ease.

7.Ahmed Hulusi: So, when you are free (of your duties) labor (for your actual duty)!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And evaluate your Rabb!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By the fig and the olive,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And by Mount Sinai,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And by this secure city,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: We have certainly created man in the best of forms (with the qualities of the Names).

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Then We reduced him to the lowest of the low (to his world of conditionings).

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Except for those who believe (in their essential reality) and fulfill the requisites of faith! For them there is an uninterrupted reward!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: So what can cause you to deny the religion after this (when the reality and the sunnatullah are so evidently observable)?

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Is Allah not the judge of all judges?

1.Ahmed Hulusi: READ with the Name of your Rabb (with the knowledge that comprises your being) who created.

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Created man from alaq (a clot of blood; genetic composition).

3.Ahmed Hulusi: READ! For your Rabb is Akram (most generous).

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Who taught (programmed the genes and the essential qualities) by the Pen.

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Taught man that which he knew not.

6.Ahmed Hulusi: No (it is not like what they think)! Indeed, man transgresses (pursues and indulges in his desires when he lives cocooned from his essence);

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Because he sees himself as self-sufficient (the veil of his ego makes him think he is not in need of the reality).

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, to your Rabb is the return!

9.Ahmed Hulusi: Did you see the one who prevents,

10.Ahmed Hulusi: A servant at prayer!

11.Ahmed Hulusi: Did you see (have a think)! What if he is living the reality?

12.Ahmed Hulusi: Or demands protection!

13.Ahmed Hulusi: Have a think! What if he denied (his essence) and turned away?

14.Ahmed Hulusi: Does he not know that Allah sees?

15.Ahmed Hulusi: No (it is not like what they think)! Indeed, if he does not desist, We will drag him by his forehead (brain)!

16.Ahmed Hulusi: A lying, mistaken (driven by corporeality) forehead (brain)!

17.Ahmed Hulusi: Then let him call his council!

18.Ahmed Hulusi: And We shall call the keepers of Hell (the degenerating forces of Fire)!

19.Ahmed Hulusi: No, do not! Do not obey him! Prostrate and draw near! (This is a verse of prostration.)

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, We disclosed it (the Quran) during the Night of Power (of Muhammad [saw])!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Do you know (the value, honor, magnificence of) the Night of Power?

3.Ahmed Hulusi: The Night of Power is better than a thousand months (a lifetime of 80 years).

4.Ahmed Hulusi: The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Rabb (Name composition) for every matter (that has manifested as Allah’s decree).

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Salam (the experience of the essence) it is until the emergence of dawn (until the consciousness recognizes the disclosure of the reality).

98.SurahEnglishNames: The Clear Proof, Evidence, The Proof

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Those deniers of the reality, from among the people of the book and the dualists, were not to part (from their excessive ways) until there came to them clear evidence.

2.Ahmed Hulusi: A Rasul from Allah, informing them of the pure pages (knowledge pertaining to the reality, which those who are not purified from the filth of duality cannot touch).

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Within which are solid books (solid – substantial – reliable information).

4.Ahmed Hulusi: But those to whom a Book was given fell into diversion after the clear evidence had come to them.

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Whereas they were not commanded with anything other than to serve Allah by devoting their faith to Him as a Hanif (without the concept of a deity; with the consciousness of being in servitude to Allah alone), to establish salat and to give alms... This is the (valid) religion (system)!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, those who deny the knowledge of the reality, from among the people of the book and the dualists, are in the Fire, to abide therein eternally! They are the most evil of the people!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: As for those who believe and fulfill the requisites of faith, they are the best of people!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: The respite of their deeds in the sight of their Rabb is Paradises of Eden, underneath which rivers flow, to abide therein eternally... Wellpleased is Allah with them, and well-pleased are they with Him (the reflections of divine qualities)... This is for he who is in awe of his Rabb!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: When the earth (the body) is shaken with an intense quake,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And the earth discharges its burdens,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And man (consciousness panics and) asks, “What is wrong with it (the body)?”

4.Ahmed Hulusi: That is the time it will report its news,

5.Ahmed Hulusi: With a revelation from your Rabb.

6.Ahmed Hulusi: That day the people will go forth in groups to see the results of their deeds!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Whoever does an iota’s weight of good will see it,

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And whoever does an iota’s weight of evil will see it.

100.SurahEnglishNames: The Courser, The Chargers, The Assulters

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By the racers (people who are like wild horses), panting (to collect worldly wealth),

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Striking sparks of fire (out of their greed and anger),

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And rising at dawn to make raids,

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Who stir up clouds of dust with their greed,

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And push and hustle their way among the people in that state... (woe to them)!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, man is very ungrateful to his Rabb!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: And to this he bears witness!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, he has an intense desire for wealth!

9.Ahmed Hulusi: Does he not know when that which is in the grave (the body) is dredged up and taken out,

10.Ahmed Hulusi: And that which is in the hearts is made manifest,

11.Ahmed Hulusi: That their Rabb, as the Names comprising their essence, is ever knowing (Habir) of them.

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Ahmed Hulusi: The Qaria!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: What a dreadful event, the Qaria!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Do you know what the Qaria is?

4.Ahmed Hulusi: It is the time when the people will be like moths (propelling towards the fire).

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And the mountains (egos) like colorful soft wool (depleted and weak)!

6.Ahmed Hulusi: So the results of whomever weigh heavy (at that time),

7.Ahmed Hulusi: He will be in a life well-pleasing!

8.Ahmed Hulusi: And the results of whomever weigh light,

9.Ahmed Hulusi: His mother (abode) will be an abyss.

10.Ahmed Hulusi: Do you know what that is?

11.Ahmed Hulusi: It is a fire that scorches at maximum intensity!

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Greed (for wealth and offspring) deceived and amused you!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Even when you visited the graves...

3.Ahmed Hulusi: But no! Soon (with death) you will know.

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Again no! Soon you will know.

5.Ahmed Hulusi: No! If only you had established your certainty through knowledge (before death)...

6.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, you will definitely see the Hell!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, you will most certainly see it (Hell) with the eye of certainty.

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Then indeed, at that time you will be asked about your blessings.

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Ahmed Hulusi: By that time (the life span of man),

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, mankind is in loss!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Except for those who have believed (in their essential reality) and fulfilled the requisites of faith, advised each other of the Truth and advised each other to patience!

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Woe to every gossiper and abusive reprobate!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Who collects wealth and counts it and recounts it (constantly checking his bank account to see how much money he has)!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Thinking his wealth will make him immortal!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: No, (it is not like what he thinks)! Indeed, he will surely be thrown into the Crusher (the crushing torment).

5.Ahmed Hulusi: And what informs you of the Crusher?

6.Ahmed Hulusi: It is the inflamed fire of Allah (ignited in the mind, deriving from his nature)!

7.Ahmed Hulusi: Covering the hearts (the reflectors of the Names to consciousness).

8.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, it closes in on them (they are eternally trapped in it),

9.Ahmed Hulusi: In extended columns.

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Did you not see how your Rabb dealt with the people of the elephant?

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Did He not make their plan worthless?

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And disclosed upon them the birds in flocks (the Common Swift),

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Who threw upon them stones of hard clay,

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Until they became like eaten straw.

1.Ahmed Hulusi: In order to establish acquaintenceship and respect for the Quraysh,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: For the safety and comfort of their winter and summer journeys.

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Let them serve the Rabb of this city (as those who acknowledge the Truth of non-duality)!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: Who fed them (saving them from hunger) and secured them from fear.

107.SurahEnglishNames: Small Kindnesses, Almsgiving, Have you Seen, The Daily Necessaries

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Did you see the one who denies his religion (the sunnatullah)?

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Who scolds the orphan – pushing and shoving him,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: And who does not encourage feeding the needy (stingy, selfish)!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: So, woe to those who pray (out of custom),

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Who are heedless (cocooned) of (the experience of the meaning of) their salat (which is an ascension [miraj] to their innermost essential reality; their Rabb).

6.Ahmed Hulusi: They are the ones who make a show of their deeds,

7.Ahmed Hulusi: And prevent good!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, We gave you the Kawthar!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: So, experience salat for your Rabb and sacrifice (your ego)!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Indeed, it is the one who resents you that is cut off (whose progeny has been made discontinuous)!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Say, “O those who deny the knowledge of the reality!”

2.Ahmed Hulusi: “I do not deify that which you deify (your Inciting Self [ego]- the second brain in your gut).”

3.Ahmed Hulusi: “Nor are you worshippers of (in servitude to) what I worship.”

4.Ahmed Hulusi: “Nor will I worship (serve) that which you deify.”

5.Ahmed Hulusi: Nor will you worship (serve) what I serve.”

6.Ahmed Hulusi: “For you is your (understanding of) religion and for me is (my understanding of) religion!”

1.Ahmed Hulusi: When the help (of Allah) and the conquest (absolute clarity – conscious observation) has come,

2.Ahmed Hulusi: And you see the people entering the religion of Allah in masses,

3.Ahmed Hulusi: Glorify (tasbih) your Rabb as his Hamd and ask forgiveness of Him! Indeed, He is the Tawwab.

1.Ahmed Hulusi: May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined... And ruined he is!

2.Ahmed Hulusi: Neither his wealth nor his earnings availed him!

3.Ahmed Hulusi: He will be subject to a blazing Fire!

4.Ahmed Hulusi: His wife as well... As a wood-carrier!

5.Ahmed Hulusi: With a rope of palm-fiber around her neck!

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Say: “Allah is Ahad (One).” (Allah is the infinite, limitless and indivisible, non-dual ONENESS.)

2.Ahmed Hulusi: “Allah is Samad.” (Absolute Self-Sufficient One beyond any need or defect, free from the concept of multiplicity, and far from conceptualization and limitation. The one into whom nothing can enter, and the One from whom no other form of existence can come out!)

3.Ahmed Hulusi: “He begets not. (No other form of existence has ever originated from Him, thus, there is no other.) Nor was He begotten.” (There is no other god or form of existence from which He could have originated.)

4.Ahmed Hulusi: “There is none like unto Him!” (Nothing – no conception – in the micro or macro planes of existence is equivalent to or in resemblance of Him.)

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Say (recognize, realize, comprehend, experience): “I seek refuge in the Rabb (the reality of the Names comprising my essence) of the Falaq (the light that prevails over the darkness and brings enlightenment to me).”

2.Ahmed Hulusi: “From the evil of His creation.”

3.Ahmed Hulusi: “From the evil of the darkness that settles in my mind preventing me from perceiving and comprehending...”

4.Ahmed Hulusi: “From the evil of the women who blow on knots (those who manipulate brain waves to make black magic).”

5.Ahmed Hulusi: “And from the evil eye of the envier when he envies!”

1.Ahmed Hulusi: Say (recognize, realize, comprehend, experience): “I seek refuge in the Rabb (the reality of the Names comprising the essence) of the Nas (mankind).”

2.Ahmed Hulusi: “The Sovereign of man,” (The Malik, the One whose sovereignty and administration is absolute over Nas, mankind.)

3.Ahmed Hulusi: “The God of man,” (The reality of Uluhiyya that resides within the essence of every human, with which he subsists his existence, and mistakenly thinks this state pertains to a god outside of himself!)

4.Ahmed Hulusi: “From the evil of the whisperer that covertly pervades then retreats, and reduces man to corporeality.”

5.Ahmed Hulusi: “That which whispers illusory thoughts into man’s consciousness about man’s essential reality.”

6.Ahmed Hulusi: “From among the jinni (invisible forces) and man!”
